channel.title: cli on Pedro Junqueira
channel.description: Recent content in cli on Pedro Junqueira

item.title: Basic CLI commands for Openshift-Minishift
item.description: Here is a post with the absolute basic commands that I always forget Getting the export Path of oc CLI tool minishift oc-env export PATH="/Users/pedrojunqueira/.minishift/cache/oc/v3.11.0/darwin:$PATH" Logging in to log in oc login -u <user> -p <password> Deploy an application from git oc new-app https://github.com/sclorg/nodejs-ex -l name=myapp login as sys:admin oc login -u system:admin get users oc get users make an user called administrator a system admin oc adm policy add-cluster-role-to-user cluster-admin administrator

item.title: How: to navigate on AWS S3 bucket using CLI
item.description: Using the command line interface (CLI) can be very intimidating and make one completely lost if you always dealt with graphical drag and drop, click and point interface. I grew up in the 80s and my first interactions with computer was always through CLI and remember that the 2 first commands I learned were then cls for clear the screen and dir to list the files in the current directory. Even applications like word for MS-DOS was all text and there was no mouse then.
